intro: Wahlenbergia vinciflora var. eurycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a trailing habit, often forming dense mats on rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are bell-shaped with five petals. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dark seeds.
